Name: Buenos Aires
Description: Buenos Aires is Argentina�s big, cosmopolitan capital city. Its center is the Plaza de Mayo, lined with stately 19th-century buildings including Casa Rosada, the  presidential palace. Other major attractions include Teatro Col�n, a grand 1908 opera house with nearly 2,500 seats, and the modern MALBA museum, displaying Latin American art.
Landmarks: ['Obelisco', 'Woman's Bridge', 'Teatro Colon', 'Plaza de Mayo', 'El Ateneo Grand Splendid library', 'Estadio Monumental', 'Estadio La Bombonera']
Famous people: ['Lionel Messi', 'Jorge Luis Borges', 'Queen Maxima of the Netherlands', 'Daniel Barenboim']
Item: ['the Planetarium building', 'the FIFA World Cup trophy', 'the steps to Tango']

Name: Rio de Janeiro
Description: Rio de Janeiro is a huge seaside city in Brazil, famed for its Copacabana and Ipanema beaches, 38m Christ the Redeemer statue atop Mount Corcovado and for Sugarloaf Mountain, a granite peak with cable cars to its summit. The city is also known for its sprawling favelas (shanty towns). Its raucous Carnaval festival, featuring parade floats, flamboyant costumes and samba dancers, is considered the world�s largest.
Landmarks: Christ the Redeemer statue, the Maracana stadium, the Sugarloaf Mountain, Copacabana Beach, Escadaria Selaron, Sambadrome
Famous people: Pele, Gisele B�ndchen, Ronaldinho Gaucho, Morena Baccarin, Caetano Veloso, Paulo Cohelo
Item: the sand from Copacabana Beach, the steps of Escadaria Selaron, Pele's favourite jersey

Name: Tokyo
Description: Tokyo, Japan�s busy capital, mixes the ultramodern and the traditional, from neon-lit skyscrapers to historic temples. The opulent Meiji Shinto Shrine is known for its towering gate and surrounding woods. The Imperial Palace sits amid large public gardens. The city's many museums offer exhibits ranging from classical art (in the Tokyo National Museum) to a reconstructed kabuki theater (in the Edo-Tokyo Museum).
Landmarks: Mount Fuji, the Tokyo Tower, the Rainbow Bridge, the Imperial Palace, Shinjuku Golden Gai
Famous people: Haruki Murakami, Akira Kurosawa, Akira Toriyama, Naomi Osaka, Suzuka Nakamoto, Emperor Naruhito
Item: Emperor Naruhito's chopsticks, the snow from Mount Fuji, the first draft copy of Dragon Ball
